title: Java StringcodePointBefore()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java StringcodePointBefore()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Java String
codePointBefore
content_sections.content:
()
Method

Example
Return the Unicode of the first character in a string (the Unicode value 
  of "H" is 72):
String myStr = "Hello";
int result = myStr.codePointBefore(1);
System.out.println(result);

Definition and Usage
The
codePointBefore()
method returns the Unicode 
value of the character before the specified index in a string.
The index of the first character is 1, the second character is 2, and so on.
Note:
The value 0 will generate an error, as this is a negative number (out 
of reach).
Syntax
public int codePointBefore(int
index
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
index
An
int
value, representing the index 
    following the Unicode that should be returned
Technical Details
Returns:
An
int
value, representing the Unicode 
  value before the specified index
Throws:

content_sections.title: IndexOutOfBoundsException
content_sections.content:
- if index is negative or not less than the length of 
  the specified string
Java Version:
1.5

★
+1
